text: Status update on roof rules: Just met with Joe (from Beam) and passed along a tool recommendation + discussed signage, norms and process.
nice

Joe is going to take my recommendations, review OLCC recommendations and then create a meeting between tenant representatives so we can all meet and greet and are operating with a shared understanding
OLCC?
for roof?
as in the scheduling also needs to consider liquor license stuff, and our ability to calendar reserve is entangled in that since its the same process for booking a big ole event?
regulations for glass on the roof, including a bottle of beer.

From Joe’s POV, a reservation for exclusive access is a reservation for exclusive access and counts against our allotment. However, we’d be free to hold team meetings, etc. up on the roof and give our building partners a heads up, with the expectation that they don’t want to be bad roomates

We are thinking maybe 2 different types of reservation. 1.) Reservation from the restaurant below (they have 8 I believe) where customers will be coming in and they don’t want anyone else to join 2.) Less formal reservation where we are just letting people know there will be a lot of Uncorked employees up there and it might not be a quite place
8 per what unit of time?

Joe is going to work with insurance company and Beam to come up with a fair (but cool) alcohol process. Current insurance POV is any alcohol without a permit (takes a few weeks to get and cost $100) removes them from all liability. He is going to see what slack is in there and let us know. Nobody wants to get a permit to just enjoy a beer.
8 evenings I believe. Though we are going to work together so that no one tenant can claim everyone Friday/Saturday night for example

<@U02918BKW|john> uploaded a file: <https://uncorked.slack.com/files/john/F4Q8692BG/pasted_image_at_2017_03_24_03_56_pm.png|Pasted image at 2017-03-24, 3:56 PM> and commented: uncorked roof access rights
Way I’m reading this is that Uncorked doesn’t have a set # of days we can use the roof?
Beam has 8 days
8 days per month is 26.3% of the days
that's a lot
Yes it is. Question is if those 8 days satisfy all other tenants are not
so potentially they could take every thursday/friday of the month?
Joe and I talked about that and both agreed that would be unsporting for any company to take that approach
or basically he said that they (beam) wouldn’t do that and that they wouldn’t let Danwei do that
Main thing is that we are all going to get together and come up with a amicable approach that meets legal agreements and gives us a good working relationship
After consulting with several friends who run shared spaces, I proposed we use <https://www.gatherhere.com/>

attachments.title: Gather - Event Management Software for Restaurants & Venues
attachments.text: Gather is the leading event management software for restaurants and venues. We enable hospitality companies of all sizes to manage and grow their events.
attachments.fallback: Gather: Gather - Event Management Software for Restaurants & Venues

text: or <https://youcanbook.me/>

attachments.title: Online scheduling tool for customer bookings - YouCanBook.me
attachments.text: The Easiest Way To Take Bookings Online. Let people book fixed length slots straight into your Google Calendar
attachments.fallback: Online scheduling tool for customer bookings - YouCanBook.me

text: Gather is a bit more robust and has a booking approval team. <http://Youcanbook.me|Youcanbook.me> is a bit more lightweight (simpler) and more cost effective
Thanks for the quick work <@U0B9N0HF0>
nice. do you know the pricing for gatherhere? is either buried or not findable without a sales demo.
and FWIW i thought we had exclusive access but that must have been something we gave up during negotiations.
